alert.note: Alert for Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 4:34PM EDT until July 29 at 5:34AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Whitesburg affecting Letcher County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Whitesburg. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The latest reported stage was at 10:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 20.9 feet. The river crested around 21.0 feet at about noon Thursday and was reported to be falling rapidly (below the bridge in Whitesburg). - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EDT Thursday was around 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 2.5 feet by late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 10 PM EDT.
